III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 - Sufficiency of staff.
Section (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
Description supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
1

Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation A youth is touching another youth inappropriately. The youth
touches the other youth on the shoulders and neck and hugs the
youth to ensure their breast touches each other. This makes the
receiving youth scared. The other youth peeks in the youth's
room and accompanied a staff member into the room this
morning.
Investigation Interviews
The following interviews were completed at Vista Maria on
03/13/2025 unless otherwise noted.
An interview was completed with Compliance. He was advised of
the allegations. Compliance denied knowledge of any
inappropriate behavior between the youth. He agreed to provide a
copy of the incident report and agency policy. Compliance also
provided documentation that the agency is aware of the need for
glasses for Youth B. He reviewed the nursing note and advised
that the glasses have been ordered and will not be returned until
about three weeks. He agreed to contact the nurse and clinical
manager to see if they can be expedited.
An interview was completed with Youth A. She confirmed that
she was initially uncomfortable around Youth B and thought her
interactions were weird but later realized that Youth B may have
just been friendly or trying to help her. She reported multiple staff
would have seen the interactions between them, but she did not
recall the names of any of the staff. Youth A denied that she feels
uncomfortable around any other youth and denied that youth have
entered her room with or without staff.
An interview was completed with Youth B. She denied any of the
allegations are true and denied going into Youth A’s room. Youth
B reported Youth C began these rumors and said it to staff and
none of it is true. She confirmed that she was braiding the hair of
Youth A and that is the only time she was very close to her.
An interview was completed with Youth C. She reported Youth A
told her that she felt uncomfortable around Youth B. Youth C
advised that she told Youth A to tell the school staff if she felt
uncomfortable. Youth C reported that after Youth A told the staff,
she later switched it up and is now saying she didn’t say that and
the reported things didn’t happen. Youth C reported she saw
Youth B whispering to Youth A, she saw Youth B put her hand on
2

the shoulder and neck of Youth B and saw Youth B braiding Youth
A's hair. Youth C was unable to say whether or not the
interactions she witnessed between Youth A and Youth B seemed
inappropriate or unwanted by either youth.
An interview was completed with Staff 1. She denied knowledge
of any concerns. She denied seeing any inappropriate contact
between Youth A and Youth B. She further denied that Youth A
ever reported she felt uncomfortable with any of her peers. She
also confirmed that a safety plan is in place and both youth are not
allowed to be within a certain proximity of each other.
An interview was completed with Staff 2. She denied knowledge
of any complaints by youth regarding inappropriate touching or
youth coming into their room. She denied that Youth A or Youth B
have expressed concerns about feeling uncomfortable. She
confirmed that agency policy does not allow youth to go into the
rooms of each other and staff enforces this policy and redirects
any negative behavior.
On 03/14/2025 a voicemail message was left for Complainant
requested a return call with any additional concerns. On
04/16/2025 an in-person meeting was held with Complainant and
no additional concerns were noted.
On 03/14/2025 a voicemail message was left for Foster Care
Worker requesting a return call with any concerns regarding
Youth A and current placement at Vista Maria.
On 03/28/2025 a telephone call was made to Staff 3. A voicemail
message was left requesting a return call. On 04/16/2025 a
telephone interview was held with Staff 3. She confirmed she is a
youth specialist assigned to Myriam. She denied witnessing or
having knowledge of Youth B inappropriately touching or
disrespecting the space of Youth A. She reported the staff are
constantly speaking with the girls about boundaries, because they
all seem to have a lack of respect of them. Staff 4 denied that
Youth A specifically advised her that she felt uncomfortable
around Youth B. She confirmed after Youth A expressed the
concerns that a safety plan was implemented. She reported both
youth are engaging appropriately and no additional concerns have
been noted.
On 03/28/2025 a telephone call was made to Staff 4. A voicemail
message was left requesting a return call. On 04/16/2025 a
telephone interview was completed with Staff 4. He confirmed he
3

is a youth specialist at Myriam. He reported Youth A “frequently”
has concerns about feeling uncomfortable with everyone. He
denied knowledge of their being issues between Youth A and
Youth B or having knowledge of any inappropriate touching. Staff
4 also reported that staff do not allow youth to go into the
bedrooms of each other and had no knowledge of it occurring with
or without staff present. He reported a safety plan was
implemented when the concerns were reported. He lastly
reported both Youth A and Youth B remain placed in the same
unit and no additional concerns have been noted. They have
been seen engaging cordially.
On 04/16/2025 an in-person interview was completed with School
Supervisor at Vista Maria. She reported Youth A asked to see
her at school and stated she felt uncomfortable with another youth
(identified as Youth B). School Supervisor reported Youth A
stated that Youth B would touch her and hug her and it made her
feel uncomfortable. School Supervisor confirmed both youth are
currently attending the school, a safety plan was implemented and
no other concerns have been noted. School supervisor denied
ever seeing or having knowledge of inappropriate contact between
Youth A and Youth B.
Documents Reviewed
Vista Maria Client Supervision Policy (POL 005 008) - Policy
states the following: Clients on all units are to be continually
supervised. Staff members who are responsible for client
supervision should maintain line of sight management of those
clients at all times.
Vista Maria Incident Report – Report is dated 03/10/2025 an
indicates that Youth A informed School Supervisor she is allegedly
being touched inappropriately by Youth B. She reported that
Youth B peeks into her room, touches her neck and shoulders and
makes her hug her to the point that their breast touch. Youth A
stated this makes her feel scared, unsafe and traumatized. She
reported today Youth B entered her room with a staff and Youth A
became upset. The report was submitted by School Supervisor.
Tour of Facility
A tour of Myriam Hall of Vista Maria was completed on
03/13/2025. No concerns were noted, and the facility was found
to be well maintained. During the tour, it was noted that youth in
the program each have their own bedroom. Agency staff advised
that youth are not allowed in the bedrooms of each other.
4

Analysis At the conclusion of the investigation, the agency was found to be
in compliance with the licensing rule. Both youth and staff were
interviewed and no concerns regarding youth making other youth
feel uncomfortable were noted. In addition, Youth A reported
during her interview that she initially thought the actions of Youth
B were weird but later realized that the other youth was just trying
to be nice. Youth A denied feeling unsafe or uncomfortable at her
placement.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
